body:
With that patch, anyone on windows who does not care about color would get that warning. Here's a change I think should work: 7c4506f29cf675ca4cc74fa610b8f68c833ec962

I don't have access to a windows machine so would you kindly build from the color-on-windows branch and tell me if it works?

You're right. I didn't think about that. Unfortunately your change doesn't work because settings[:output_stream] is nil so:
 using_stdout = settings[:output_stream] == $stdout
will always set using_stdout to false and that will prevent correct setting of output and error streams after requiring 'win32console'.
I see that this fix is not included in rc. Will it be in the final version?
Yes - I just tagged this 2.0 and will make sure it's addressed for the final version.

Assign error streams before running config options
- this ensures that the output stream is assigned before win32console
  swaps out $stdout and/or $stderr
- Closed by 686cad418afe4f8e8cc69fc98e3e7c75482f3482.
@bosko - pls verify this works as expected.
In 2.0.0 the colors displayed correctly. But when I use it with spork, the ANSI-Codes (‚Üê[32m.) appear.
@tbuehl - can you grab 6e9cba6bd5a97944a25ea8f5a0127e55843ea0f3 and let me know if it fixes that for you?
No, this isn't working. I don't use autotest if that helps you.
@tbuehl are you seeing the ANSI codes instead of color, or in addition to?
Only the ANSI codes when I use it with spork.
It doesn't work either with autospec, so it will be probably the same problem as with spork.
Seems to be issue of autotest, exactly this commit: http://github.com/grosser/autotest/commit/d827a4a5004ae3d89be45b61422ad500c79d4f52
I don't think so because I am not using autotest.

To be precise: you can blame either win32console, because it doesn't support "puts" or you can blame author of spork who did not adjusted spork appropriately to work with limitations of win32console. It is not fault of RSpec as far as I can say, because if you run "rspec some_spec.rb" there are colors. If you revert in autotest the commit I mentioned above, then the colors are displayed correctly again.
